title: Pilot keeps running after game ends, wasting LLM calls on dead bridge
description:
When a game ends and the Java bridge disconnects, the pilot loop continues calling the LLM indefinitely. All MCP tools return {"error": ""} (empty error string) but the pilot has no logic to detect this means the game is over.

Observed in:
- game_20260214_142305_g3: GPT5n Libby ran for 28 minutes after defeat, ~200 wasted LLM calls
- game_20260214_115320_g1: Gem3P Stoic ran for 19 minutes after defeat, ~300 wasted LLM calls

The pattern: game ends → bridge logs GAME_OVER and disconnects → all tool results become {"error": ""} → pilot keeps calling LLM → stall detector fires every 20 turns → context resets → repeat forever.

Fix: detect when all tool calls return empty errors (or specifically detect the bridge disconnect) and exit the pilot loop gracefully.
